content.description: Easy scramble to a layback allow for a brief waltz to the back of the corner where thin fingers and delicate stemming takes you to the top of the corner.  Stem out carefully to the left and grab a large jub from both sides.  Stretch up high to a layback in an offwidth (pumpy) and crank until you get over the bulge.  Airy and fun.  Strenuous.
content.protection: Toprope, 2 chains.  Leading is not recommended due to a few scratchy footholds that need cleaning and 1 loose handhold, as well as relatively poor pro while getting under the offwidth bulge.  Pro in the crack is okay, a large offwidth cam could protect the layback.
content.location: Just left of the bolted line, follow the natural weakness to the back of a deep stemming corner.  You can't miss it.

content.description: Open-book rock formation on the Mundy's Gap Trail.
